author: tbenr
content:
A curiosity: CL devs, which timeout are you applying to `builder_getPayload` call? I recently reduced it from 8s (clearly too high) to 1s to be aligned to `engine_getPayload`. 
our current stats in goerli are this:

author: tersec
content: Nimbus also uses 1 second, because it's what https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/blob/v0.2.0/specs/validator.md#constants suggests as `BUILDER_PROPOSAL_DELAY_TOLERANCE`

author: tbenr
content: But that param in particular should be applied to the getHeader to maintain "the door open" for the local alternative. On getPayload you don't have any alternative anymore...

author: tersec
content: Sure, it's a tradeoff, but I generally took it as a cue for a maximum possible timeout. But it's a good argument, that it's potentially worth waiting longer on that for that reason.

author: tbenr
content:
That's why I was referencing the `engine_getPayload`  for a similar situation, which has a 1s timeout per spec. But it do not take in account big network delays since it assumes a local EL. But it is also true that in `builder_getPayload` we probably going to call it later compared to the engine version due to the accumulated latency for the previous getHeader roundtrip.
So maybe the reason behind 1s on engine_getPayload at the end can still hold on the builder version.
